sen.j: 七手組（ななてぐみ）とは、豊臣秀吉が創設した旗本衆。
sen.e: Nanate-gumi is a group of vassals that was organized by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI..
Nanate-gumi (Hideyoshi's seven troops) is a group of vassals that was organized by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI..
Nanate-gumi (Hideyoshi's seven troops) is a group of vassals that was organized by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI..

sen.j: 七隊長・御馬廻七頭とも言われている。
sen.e: They are also called Nana-taicho or Oumamawari-shichigashira.
They are also called Nana-taicho or Oumamawari-shichigashira.
They are also called Nana-taicho or Oumamawari-shichigashira.

sen.j: 七手組は秀吉が存命中に約1万の精鋭を7つの部隊にわけ、豊臣家の身辺警護から朝廷への儀礼などに用いた部隊。
sen.e: Nanate-gumi indicates the specially selected 10,000 warriors divided into 7 groups by Hideyoshi, and they were engaged in body guarding the Toyotomi family, the rituals for the Imperial Court, etc.

Nanate-gumi indicates military units which Hideyoshi selected about 10,000 elite warriors and divided into seven during his life, and they worked as bodyguards of the Toyotomi family and for rituals for the Imperial Court, and the like.
sen.cmt: 約 about 追加など表現変更
sen.e: Nanate-gumi indicates military units which Hideyoshi selected about 10,000 elite warriors and divided into seven during his life, and they worked as bodyguards of the Toyotomi family and for rituals for the Imperial Court, and the like.

sen.j: 組頭は概ね1万石程度の所領を持っている。
sen.e: Kumigashira (commander of each group) owned the territory valued approximately 10,000 koku.
Kumigashira (commander of each group) owned the territory valued approximately 10,000 koku.
Kumigashira (commander of each group) owned the territory valued approximately 10,000 koku.

sen.j: 秀吉死後は豊臣秀頼に仕え、関ヶ原の戦いでは主に大坂城の警護任務に終始した。
sen.e: They served Hideyori TOYOTOMI after the death of Hideyoshi, and they focused on protecting the Osaka Castle during the Battle of Sekigahara.
They served Hideyori TOYOTOMI after the death of Hideyoshi, and mainly focused on protecting the Osaka Castle during the Battle of Sekigahara.
They served Hideyori TOYOTOMI after the death of Hideyoshi, and mainly focused on protecting the Osaka Castle during the Battle of Sekigahara.

sen.j: （一部は関ヶ原で西軍側につき参戦）
sen.e: (A part of Nanate-gumi participated in the battle to support the Western Troop in Sekigahara.)
(A part of Nanate-gumi participated in the battle to support the Western Army in Sekigahara.)
(A part of Nanate-gumi participated in the battle to support the Western Army in Sekigahara.)

sen.j: 晩年は秀吉より任命された組頭も引退し、その子たちが受け継いだため戦闘力の著しい低下を招いた。
sen.e: In later days the Kumigashiras appointed directly by Hideyoshi retired and their sons succeeded the post, however the troops' fighting force was weakened significantly.
In later days the Kumigashiras appointed directly by Hideyoshi retired and their sons succeeded the post, however the troops' fighting force had weakened significantly.
In later days the Kumigashiras appointed directly by Hideyoshi retired and their sons succeeded the post, however the troops' fighting force had weakened significantly.

sen.j: 1615年の大坂の役では七手組組頭7人の内の4人までが落城と共に討ち死にする壮絶な最期を遂げた。
sen.e: In Osaka-no-eki (the Siege of Osaka) in 1615, 4 out of 7 Nanate-gumi Kumigashiras died a heroic death at the time of the fall of the castle.
In Osaka-no-eki (the Siege of Osaka) in 1615, four out of seven Nanate-gumi Kumigashiras died a heroic death at the time of the fall of the castle.
In Osaka-no-eki (the Siege of Osaka) in 1615, four out of seven Nanate-gumi Kumigashiras died a heroic death at the time of the fall of the castle.

sen.j: ただ、青木一重は徳川家家臣であったが、秀吉が家康に頼んで移籍させた人物である。
sen.e: Kazushige Aoki used to be a vassal of the Tokugawa family, but was transferred to the Toyotomi family due to Hideyoshi's special request to Ieyasu.
Among them, Kazushige Aoki was a former vassal of the Tokugawa family, but was transferred to the Toyotomi family by the Hideyoshi's special request to Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.
Among them, Kazushige Aoki was a former vassal of the Tokugawa family, but was transferred to the Toyotomi family by the Hideyoshi's special request to Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: そのため、大坂冬の陣後に徳川家に復帰している。
sen.e: Therefore, he returned to the Tokugawa family after Osaka-fuyu-no-jin (Osaka Winter Campaign).
Therefore, he returned to the Tokugawa family after Osaka Fuyu no Jin (Winter Siege of Osaka).
sen.cmt: 用語共有リストに沿い単語変更
sen.e: Therefore, he returned to the Tokugawa family after Osaka Fuyu no Jin (Winter Siege of Osaka).

sen.j: 伊東は徳川家の、真野は藤堂高虎の家臣となっている。
sen.e: Ito became a vassal of the Tokugawa family, and Mano became that of Takatora TODO later on.
Ito became a vassal of the Tokugawa family, and Mano became that of Takatora TODO later on.
Ito became a vassal of the Tokugawa family, and Mano became that of Takatora TODO later on.
